content: 10 2hdc in next st remove marker and set aside half_double_crochet 30 to the next marked st place 2 half_double_crochet in marked st remove marker and set aside half_double_crochet 10 2 half_double_crochet in next stitch remove marker half_double_crochet 30 to first marked st of the round 88 round 5 without joining work a half_double_crochet st in each stitch around to end 88 continue to use the st marker to help identify the first st of each round move it up as you begin each round 88 rounds 6 - 11 repeat round 5 6 xs at the end of round 11 continue to work your half_double_crochet sts to the center side edge then fasten_off color a and continue on to part 2 using colors b and c held together move your stitch marker to the top of the first stitch you make with colors b and c together this is now stitch 1 88 cal part 2 - working the body and top band rounds 12 - 21 using colors b and c together continue to work 10 rounds in half_double_crochet continue to move the marker up as you complete each round at the end of round 21 work half_double_crochet sts until you reach the center side edge then fasten_off color b and join color d move your stitch marker to the top of the first stitch you make with colors c and d together this is now stitch 1 88 rounds 22 - 25 using colors c and d together work 4 rounds of half_double_crochet slip_stitch one or two stitches beyond the last st of round 25 to end the round 88 round 26 chain 2 work alternating fpdc and bpdc around the post of each half_double_crochet in the previous round you will end the round with a bpdc slip_stitch to the top of the 1st fpdc to join the round 88 round 27 chain 2 work alternating bpdc and fpdc sts beginning with a bpdc for this round you will work around each post of the previous round working bpdc sts around the post of a fpdc and fpdc sts around the post of a bpdc this will create a nice dense top band you will end the round with a fpdc slip_stitch to the top of the 1st bpdc to join the round 88 round 28 repeat round 26 beginning with a fpdc you will work all fpdc sts around the post of a bpdc and all bpdc sts around the post of a fpdc slip_stitch to the top of the 1st fpdc to join the round 88 cal part 3 - working the handle strap fasten_off both colors c and d after completing round 28 lay your bag out on a flat surface locate and place a st marker optional in the center side edge on both the right and left side with one marked st facing you count 12 sts to the right of the center and place a st marker in it then count
